p: The high mineral content found in Lebanese cumin is close to that of Iranian one (9.5%) [ 57, 60, 61]. In addition, the levels found in Algerian and Syrian cumins are comparable to those found in Egyptian cumin (7.7%) [ 61] and in Indian cumin (7.3 to 8.0%) [ 60, 62]. These values are below the maximum limit for cumin seeds according to the International Standards Organization (ISO: 9301/2003): 12%.
